page.title: 05Farming-Change of Land Use
page.content: Few people realise how much the{Vale {of Evesham,}famous for its horticultural produce and often called the{Garden of England,}has changed over the past 30 years,farming having taken over in large areas from market gardening. In this area, where the easily workable, light, warm soils are ideal for horticultural purposes,{corn {and sugar beet}are now grown where there were formerly fields of{peas, {runner beans, brussels sprouts, {cabbages, leeks etc.}Gone too are the {plum orchards}where the attractive blossom in April attracted visitors from all parts of the Midlands, and bands of gypsies and travellers in August, to pick the perishable short season crop.
